tutorialSidebar.label: Welcome to Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics

hardware-requirements.title: Hardware Requirements
hardware-requirements.description: This page details the hardware components required for hands-on labs in the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course. You have two main options: NVIDIA Jetson-based setup (recommended for embedded robotics) or Desktop/Laptop with GPU (suitable for simulation-heavy workflows).

intro.title: Welcome to Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics
intro.description: Welcome to the AI-Native Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Textbook â€” your interactive guide to mastering the cutting-edge field of embodied artificial intelligence and humanoid robotics.

learning-outcomes.title: Learning Outcomes
learning-outcomes.description: This page outlines the competencies you will develop by completing the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course. Learning outcomes are organized by Bloom's Taxonomy levels and mapped to specific course modules.

personalization-example.title: Getting Started with ROS 2
personalization-example.description: Learn the basics of ROS 2 - Personalized learning experience

placeholder.title: Coming Soon
placeholder.description: This module is currently under development and will be available soon.

quarter-overview.title: Quarter Overview
quarter-overview.description: This page provides a comprehensive overview of the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course, detailing the curriculum structure, weekly topics, assessments, and deliverables across the entire quarter.

weeks-01-02/index.title: Weeks 1-2: ROS 2 Foundations
weeks-01-02/index.description: Welcome to the first module of the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course! In these two weeks, you'll build a solid foundation in ROS 2 (Robot Operating System 2), the industry-standard framework for robot software development.

weeks-03-04/index.title: Weeks 3-4: Computer Vision & Perception
weeks-03-04/index.description: In this module, you'll build computer vision pipelines for robot perception using deep learning and 3D sensing technologies. You'll deploy object detection models on edge devices and integrate depth cameras with ROS 2.
